s2.message: If you know JavaScript, you can work on Adblock Plus for Firefox or Adblock Plus for Chrome and Opera.

s3.message: If you know Python, you can work on the build system or the backend.

s4.message: If you know C++, you can work on libadblockplus or Adblock Plus for Internet Explorer.

s5.message: If you know Java, you can work on Adblock Plus for Android.

s6.message: Note that most of our projects are also on GitHub, if you prefer that.

s8.message: If you picked something to work on, or need help finding something, drop by our IRC channel: #adblockplus on irc.mozilla.org. There's also a web-based client.

s10.message: Once you've made and tested your changes, first make sure they're in line with our coding style.

s11.message: Now you can send us your patch. You can either find someone on IRC to review it and send it to them via email, or create a pull request on GitHub.

s12.message: Finally, before we can accept your patch, you need to sign the contributor agreement. Please print it out, sign it, scan that or take a picture of it and send it to one of your reviewers.
